document.masterDocTitle: Oribatid mites (Acari: Oribatida) recorded from Ireland: Catalogue, historical records, species habitats and geographical distribution, combinations, variations and synonyms

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Oribatid mites (Acari: Oribatida) recorded from Ireland: Catalogue, historical records, species habitats and geographical distribution, combinations, variations and synonyms

subSubSection.paragraph:
·
Inigozetes reticulatus Pérez-Íñigo, 1969

· Original name:
Minunthozetes reticulatus Pérez-Íñigo, 1969
.

· Historical combinations/variations:
Minunthozetes ( Inigozetes ) reticulatus (Pérez-Íñigo) Subías, 2004
. Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Soil and moss on soil surface in Sitka spruce forest (Arroyo and Bolger 2007); pastures, wetland pastures and blanket bogs (under rough grazing) (Arroyo et al. 2009a). Counties: Galway, Kerry, Laois, Mayo and Offaly.

·
Minunthozetes pseudofusiger (Schweizer, 1922)

· Original name:
Oribata pseudofusiger Schweizer, 1922
.
· In: Verhandlungen der Naturforschenden Gesellschaft in Basel , 33, 59.

· Historical combinations/variations:
Punctoribates ( Minunthozetes ) pseudofusiger (Schweizer) Sellnick, 1928
;
Minunthozetes ( Minunthozetes ) pseudofusiger (Schweizer) Subías, 2004
.

· Synonyms: (?)
Punctoribates atomus Berlese, 1908
“sp. inq.”;
Minunthozetes ( M. ) quadriareatus Mínguez, Subías and Ruiz, 1986
.
Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Agricultural soil, grass and bracken. (Bolger In press) Counties: Mayo .

·
Minunthozetes semirufus (C.L. Koch, 1841)
*

· Original name:
Zetes semirufus C.L. Koch, 1841
.
· In: Deutschlands Crustaceen, Myriapoden und Arachniden , Vol. 31 (7).

Minunthozetes ( Minunthozetes ) semirufus (C.L. Koch) Subías, 2004
.
Mihelčič, 1957.

Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Gorse, pine needles, moss and
Sphagnum
, (Halbert 1915 and Halbert’s unpublished notes); agricultural grassland (Curry 1969, 1969b, 1970, 1971, 1973, 1976, 1976b; Valarasan 1971; Ganley 1976; O’Neill 1981; Arroyo et al. 2015; unpublished data); soil in Western hemlock and Monterey pine plots (unpublished data);
Iris bog
at seashore (Purvis 1982); cutaway raised bog and permanent pasture on peat (both soil and herbage) (Whelan 1978, 1985, 1986); funga sporocarps (unpublished data); pastures, corn, potatoes, barley, wheat and oats crops, broadleaved forest (Hawthorn and ash mixed wood, birch), Sitka spruce forests and blanket bogs (rough grazing) (Arroyo et al. 2009a); moss on soil in Scots pine forests (Arroyo and Bolger 2007; Arroyo et al. 2012, 2013b); raised bogs and fens (Wisdom et al. 2011); ant nests (Arroyo et al. 2015).
Counties: Dublin , Cork , Galway , Kerry , Kildare , Laois , Louth , Limerick , Mayo , Meath , Monaghan , Offaly , Tipperary , Waterford , Wexford and Wicklow .

·
Minunthozetes tarmani Feider, Vasiliu and Călugăr, 1971

· Original name:
Allozetes tarmani Feider et al. , 1971
.

· In: Un nouveau genre et une nouvelle espèce de la famille Mycobatidae (Oribatei) .
Revue Roumanie de Biologie, série de Zoologie
, 16, 299–308.

· Historical combinations/variations:
Minunthozetes ( Minunthozetes ) tarmani (Feider et al .) Subías, 2004
. Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Fungal sporocarps (O’Connell 1994). Counties: Kilkenny .

·
Mycobates parmeliae (Michael, 1884)
*

· Original name:
Oribata parmeliae Michael, 1884
.

· In:
British Oribatidae
. Vols. I and II. Ray Soc., London. 656 pp.

· Historical combinations/variations:
Notaspis parmeliae (Michael) Oudemans, 1900
;
Mycobates ( Mycobates ) parmeliae (Michael) Subías, 2004
.

· Synonyms:
Sphaerozetes ( Trichoribates ) lenicomus Berlese, 1910
;
Mycobates nadiji Paulitchenko, 1991
. Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Under lichens growing on large boulders on the seashore (Halbert 1915, 1920; Evans et al. 1961).

·
Mycobates sarekensis (Trägårdh, 1910)

· Original name:
Oribata sarekensis Trägårdh, 1910
.
· In: Acariden aus dem Sarekgebirge. Naturwissenschaftliche Untersuchungen des Sarekgebirges in Schwedisch-Lappland, 4, 375–586.

· Historical combinations/variations:
Calyptozetes sarekensis (Trägårdh) Thor, 1929
;
Mycobates ( Calyptozetes ) sarekensis (Trägårdh) Subías, 2004
.

· Synonyms:
Mycobates consimilis Hammer, 1952
.
Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Lichen (Seyd 1992).

·
Punctoribates punctum (C.L. Koch, 1839)
*

· Original name:
Oribates punctum C.L. Koch, 1839
.
· In: Deutschlands Crustaceen, Myriapoden und Arachniden, 30 (22).

· Historical combinations/variations:
Punctoribates ( Punctoribates ) punctum (C.L. Koch) Subías, 2004
.

· Synonyms:
Oribata avenifera Michael, 1884
;
Punctoribates latilobatus Kunst, 1958
. Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Under limestone flakes and under stones a little above high-water mark (Halbert 1920; Evans et al. 1961); agricultural grassland (Curry 1969, 1976, 1979; Valarasan 1971; Cunningham 1975; Ganley 1976; Curry and Tuohy, 1978; Purvis 1978; Bolger 1980; Arroyo et al. 2015; unpublished data); bog and heather on peat (Longworth 1973); acid pet bog (Behan-Pelletier and Hill, 1983); cutaway raised bog (Whelan 1976; Curry and Momen 1988); permanent pasture on peat (Whelan 1976); sugar beet field (Breslin 1979; Curry and Purvis 1982); wheat field (Kelly and Curry 1985); pasture at seashore (Purvis 1982); pastures, Sitka spruce forests and arable field (Arroyo et al. 2009a); soil in Sitka spruce forests (Arroyo et al. 2012, 2013b); riparian habitat (unpublished data); ant nests (Arroyo et al. 2015).
Counties: Dublin , Carlow , Galway , Kildare , Limerick , Mayo , Meath , Offaly , Waterford , Wexford and Wicklow .

·
Zachvatkinibates quadrivertex (Halbert, 1920)

· Original name:
Oribata quadrivertex Halbert, 1920
.
· In: The Acarina of the seashore. Proceedings of the Roya. Irish Academy 35(B), 106-152.

· Historical combinations/variations:
Punctoribates quadrivertex (Halbert) Hammer, 1952
;
Zachvatkinibates ( Zachvatkinibates ) quadrivertex (Halbert) Subías, 2004
.

· Synonyms:
Punctoribates eoeryi Mahunka, 1972
.
Irish Reference/s and Habitat/s : Under dead shells in a salt marsh, under stones lying on mud in streams and under stones on a grassy sward (Halbert 1920).
